title: The disappointed tourists of Yelp
text:
CNN Leadership
The disappointed tourists of Yelp By Corinne Purtill , for CNN Updated 0115 GMT (0815 HKT) July 22, 2015 14 photos Christ the Redeemer (Rio de Janeiro) – "I'm not sure what all the fuss is about." -- Stephanie T., Rohnert Park, California Hide Caption Eiffel Tower (Paris) – "Crowded, overrated, and ugly from up close." --Emma F., Alpharetta, Georgia Hide Caption 2 of 14 14 photos Yellowstone National Park (Wyoming) – "I want to tell you that I am not some nature hating guy. I take my kids hiking. I rock climb. The problem with the place is that it is dull. [But] If you are in the area for some reason it is worth dropping by." -- Kahlil G. Bethesda, Maryland Hide Caption 3 of 14 14 photos Colosseum (Rome) – "Yes, it looks great at night but put some lights up on that abandoned GM Assembly Plant in Detroit and you'd have about the same thing without any long visitor lines." -- Marqus R., Ft. Lauderdale, Florida Hide Caption 4 of 14 14 photos Vietnam Veterans Memorial (Washington, D.C.) – "It's a wall with a bunch of names on it. I mean NO disrespect but spice it up a bit. It's kinda boring." --Gina M., Philadelphia Hide Caption 5 of 14 14 photos Statue of Liberty (New York) – "As a proud American I wanted to love this, but was grossly underwhelmed...Old Lady Liberty is just that...old." -- Nicholas H., San Francisco Hide Caption 6 of 14 14 photos Musee du Louvre (Paris) – "Each to their own I guess, but paintings and sculptures just hold little or no interest for me." -- Andy, Nottingham, UK Hide Caption 7 of 14 14 photos Sistine Chapel (Rome) – "After seeing so many other free churches' beautiful ceillings, I was disappointed with the Sistine Chapel's ceiling." -- Chun P., San Diego Hide Caption 8 of 14 14 photos Yosemite National Park (California) – "As another reviewer stated in one word, this National Park is a "cluster[expletive]." I couldn't agree more." -- Misty P., Kapolei, Hawaii Hide Caption 9 of 14 14 photos Hagia Sophia (Istanbul) – "There is nothing much to see inside and the place is falling apart. I get that it is ancient but I have to ask where the entrance fee funds are going." -- Camie T., London Hide Caption 10 of 14 14 photos Smithsonian Museums (Washington D.C.) – "I visited about 5 of the [Smithsonian] museums and barely LEARNED anything. It was more of an exhibit of seeing "stuff" added with 1-2 sentences written in a 3 graders level. I understand a lot of foreigners come here but I feel like it should still provide some level of sophistication." -- Andrew W., Atlanta Hide Caption 11 of 14 14 photos Grand Canyon (Arizona) – "As amazing as the views are it is really kind of boring. Every 500 feet a new vantage point of the same thing: a really big hole in the ground...What would [be] nice is segway rentals." -- Brad M., Englewood, Colorado Hide Caption 12 of 14 14 photos NOMA (Copenhagen) – "One of the courses literally made me gag but in NOMA, spitting into your napkin would be [like a] crime so I swallowed it like a bitter pill." -- Debbie C. of Arcadia, California. Hide Caption 13 of 14 14 photos Metropolitan Museum of Art (New York) – "I refuse to pay any amount of money to see antiques collecting dust." -- Anthro Food E., New York City Hide Caption 14 of 14 (CNN) The online review site Yelp isn't just a place to compare local dry cleaners or find out if anyone, ever, has patronized the shady, constantly shuttered takeaway joint on your corner. It's also a handy tool for the international tourist, with users leaving feedback on everything from the quality of the eggs at Las Vegas casino breakfast buffets to the lines at Paris's Musee du Louvre. Yelp's users are, primarily, an enthusiastic and appreciative bunch. "Michelangelo, you really outdid yourself," user Kathryn W. of Long Island notes approvingly of the Sistine Chapel, in a characteristically positive review. But for a small but vocal minority of Yelp's unhappiest travelers, the world is full of disappointing discoveries. Such as: Museums are full of art Musee du Louvre, Paris: "Each to their own I guess, but paintings and sculptures just hold little or no interest for me."
